alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing an anilide group in which the carboxamide group is substituted with an aromatic group. They have the general structure RNC(=O)R', where R= benzene, and R = aryl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aromatic anilides

alternative_parents.description: Hydroxy acids with a 6 to 12 carbon atoms long side chain.
alternative_parents.name: Medium-chain hydroxy acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Heterocyclic compounds containing a pyrrole ring bearing a carboxamide.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrrole carboxamides

alternative_parents.description: Fatty acids with an aliphatic tail that contains between 4 and 12 carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Medium-chain fatty acids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid substituted with a hydroxyl group on the C3 carbon atom.
alternative_parents.name: Beta hydroxy acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing one or more fluorine atoms attached to a benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: Fluorobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Fatty acids with a chain that carries a halogen atom (Cl,F,I,Br).
alternative_parents.name: Halogenated fatty acids

alternative_parents.description: Fatty acids in which the chain bears a hydroxyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Hydroxy fatty acids

alternative_parents.description: Fatty acids containing a heterocyclic attached to the acyl chain.
alternative_parents.name: Heterocyclic fatty acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl fluoride functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl fluorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an amine group, which is indirectly attached to a carbonyl via an intervening vinyl (>C=C<) moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Vinylogous amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary carboxylic acid amide functional group, with the general structure RC(=O)N(R')H (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acids

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Compounds containing a pyrrole ring, which is a five-member aromatic heterocycle with one nitrogen atom and four carbon atoms.
class.name: Pyrroles

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as diphenylpyrroles. These are aromatic heterocyclic compounds with a structure based on a pyrrole ring linked to exactly two phenyl groups.

direct_parent.description: Aromatic heterocyclic compounds with a structure based on a pyrrole ring linked to exactly two phenyl groups.
direct_parent.name: Diphenylpyrroles

intermediate_nodes.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a benzene ring linked to a pyrrole ring through a CC or CN bond.
intermediate_nodes.name: Phenylpyrroles

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Heterocyclic compounds containing a pyrrole ring substituted at one or more positions.
subclass.name: Substituted pyrroles

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
